newsitem.title: ITALY: Italy Oct ind. output down 0.9 pct yr/yr-employers.
newsitem.headline: Italy Oct ind. output down 0.9 pct yr/yr-employers.

text.p: Average daily industrial output has fallen an adjusted 0.9 percent year-on-year in October, employers' organisation Confindustria said in a regular survey.
But on an adjusted month-on-month basis, industrial output rose 0.3 percent, Confindustria said.
On an unadjusted basis, taking into account one extra working day this month, industrial output has risen 3.1 percent year-on-year in October.
In the first 10 months of 1996, average daily output fell an average 0.8 percent compared with the same period last year.
Sales of manufactured products rose an unadjusted 6.4 percent year-on-year in October, with foreign demand for Italian goods rising 8.7 percent and domestic demand up 3.9 percent.
The Confindustria survey revealed a fall in both output and domestic sales for the car industry, as well as a fall in fresh orders. It gave no figures.
New orders across the industrial sector fell 0.6 percent month-on-month in October. -- Rome newsroom +396 6782501
